means: 独家经营的产品（或项目、设计等）

sentence.Network_en: People will always pay top dollar for something exclusive.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们总是会为绝无仅有的东西付出高价。

sentence.Network_en: Skiing weekends cost £58 (exclusive of travel and accommodation).
sentence.Network_cn: 周末滑雪价格为58英镑（不含交通和住宿费）。

sentence.Network_en: Many of their cheeses are exclusive to our stores in Britain.
sentence.Network_cn: 在英国，他们生产的奶酪很多只在我们商店出售。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (as a noun denoting something that excludes or causes exclusion): from medieval Latin exclusivus, from Latin excludere 'shut out' (see exclude)

entry.def: If you describe something as exclusive, you mean that it is limited to people who have a lot of money or who belong to a high social class, and is therefore not available to everyone.

example.ex: He is already a member of Britain's most exclusive club...
example.tran: 他已经是英国最高级俱乐部的成员了。

example.ex: The City was criticised for being too exclusive and uncompetitive.
example.tran: 伦敦城被指责过于奢华和缺乏竞争力。

entry.def: Something that is exclusive is used or owned by only one person or group, and not shared with anyone else.

example.ex: Our group will have exclusive use of a 60-foot boat...
example.tran: 我们小组将独用一条60英尺长的船。

example.ex: Many of their cheeses are exclusive to our stores in Britain.
example.tran: 在英国，他们生产的奶酪很多只在我们商店出售。

entry.def: If a newspaper, magazine, or broadcasting organization describes one of its reports as exclusive, they mean that it is a special report which does not appear in any other publication or on any other channel.

example.ex: He told the magazine in an exclusive interview: 'All my problems stem from drink'.
example.tran: 他在接受一家杂志社的独家采访时说：“我所有的问题都是饮酒造成的。”

entry.def: If a company states that its prices, goods, or services are exclusive of something, that thing is not included in the stated price, although it usually still has to be paid for.

example.ex: All charges for service are exclusive of value added tax...
example.tran: 所有服务费都不包括增值税。

example.ex: Skiing weekends cost £58 (exclusive of travel and accommodation).
example.tran: 周末滑雪价格为58英镑（不含交通和住宿费）。

entry.tran: 相互排斥的;互不相容的
entry.def: If two things are mutually exclusive, they are separate and very different from each other, so that it is impossible for them to exist or happen together.

example.ex: They both have learnt that ambition and successful fatherhood can be mutually exclusive.
example.tran: 他们两个人都认识到了追求理想和做个好父亲不能两者兼顾。

means.word_mean: 1. a news report that is reported first by one news organization;

sentences.sentence: "he got a scoop on the bribery of city officials"

means.word_mean: 1. not divided or shared with others;

sentences.sentence: "they have exclusive use of the machine"

means.word_mean: 2. excluding much or all; especially all but a particular group or minority;
3. not divided among or brought to bear on more than one object or objective;

sentences.sentence: "judging a contest with a single eye"

stems_affixes.word_buile: conclude[[v.结论;终结]]男→adj.决定性的;结论性的
exclude[[v.排除,隔绝]]→adj.排外的, 孤高的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 排除, 除外, 被排除在外的事物
stems_affixes.word_buile: exclude[[v.排除,隔绝]]→n.排除, 除外, 被排除在外的事物
occlude[[v.闭塞,堵塞]]男稳荽省鷑.闭塞,堵塞
preclude[[v.妨碍;阻止]]→n.排除, 阻止
con全部+clud关闭+e→全部关掉→结束
oc一再+clude=clud关闭→一再关起来不畅通→堵塞
pre预先,提前+clud关闭+e→提前关闭→阻止
se分开+clud关闭+e→分开关→隐居的

sentences.en: He often goes to the exclusive restaurants.
This bathroom is for the President's exclusive use.
sentences.cn: 这间浴室是总统专用的。

sentences.en: The story is exclusive to this newspaper.
sentences.cn: 这家报纸独家报道这个材料。
